website_summaries.verdict: Large and easy to hold, and while this utility knife’s blades tend to dull quickly, changing them is fast and easy.
pros: A durable box cutter and utility knife
Large handle makes knife easier to hold and use
Opens and retracts smoothly, and lock-back helps secure blade
Changing out blades is easy thanks to a single release button
Holster and extra blades are nice extras
cons: Handle and blades loosen up over time and wiggle during use
Some find the handle too big to use comfortably

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the best with all of the desired features for long and safe use. I have purchased over 25 carpet knives over the last few years (... and like the proverbial ball point pen that always walks off or ends up in a drawer with other pens that don't work) they disappear or don't have the right features. This knife is engineered properly.
customer_reviews.author: Wiz

customer_reviews.title: GREAT KNIFE!!
customer_reviews.text: I do quite a bit of box cutting at our church food pantry, and this is the BEST knife. I tried some cheaper ones from a well known store; but putting the blade back was way too hard. This knife has a little button, which is easy to push, and then you easily slide the blade back in. The "case" that comes with it is little small; but there is a belt clip which makes access MUCH easier anyway. The blades are good and sharp. Also, I like the heft of it in my hand...not cheap plastic; but not too heavy either. Definitely a great buy, and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: L. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Convenient knife features
customer_reviews.text: Quite useful for time to time. I like the locking mechanism for this, which is the tiny button on the side. This is contrary to traditional fixed blade folding knives, which has the locking mech in the handle of the knife parallel to the blade, which makes me feel uneasy when folding the knife back. Bought this specifically cause it can swap out blades but act as a folding knife. Feels quite durable and is a light knife, very similar to fixed blade knives of the same size. Should also not fail like utility knives with the spring mechanism, which I have seen with a few.
customer_reviews.author: Rayted_R

customer_reviews.title: This folding utility knife has several useful features. I like the removable blade guard
customer_reviews.text: This folding utility knife has several useful features. I like the removable blade guard, and the ease of changing blades. I also like the push-button lock to keep it securely in either the open or closed position. Its compact size makes it easy to secure in the holster provided, and the belt loop makes it convenient to wear on your belt. I think the designers of this utility knife have addressed practically all of the areas where other knives fell short. I highly recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Wild Bill

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Used for box cutting and after a couple weeks the button that holds the blade in broke. Don’t waist your money on this knife!
customer_reviews.author: jay burns

customer_reviews.title: Broke with very light use
customer_reviews.text: The small piece of metal that secures the blade sheared after about six months of very light, homegamer , use. Only used about once a week to open plastic bags of birdseed, smoker pellets, and cat litter. The hex bolts they use to put the damn thing together are between 1.5 and 2mm; I can not get the thing open to photo the failure.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, huge flaw
customer_reviews.text: I've gotten two of these knives and they both broke in the same exact way. The little button they use to lock the blade in place has broken into pieces. I would recommend this knife if you never have it in your pocket, otherwise, be extremely careful as I almost cut myself because the blade became dislodged. Extremely unfortunate since I do like the design and ease of use. Maybe change the locking mechanism to a screw or something more durable? It's not like you need to change the blade constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Fields

customer_reviews.title: Get the Milwaukee 48-22-1903 Fastback 3 instead
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one and theat the same time, and the latter is much better. The Milwaukee is more comfortable (smoother and wider), can more easily be opened and closed with one hand (by pushing the release button and swinging the folding part out or in), it folds better and it has a storage compartment for replacement blades. The Fancii is a little cheaper, cuts a little better out of the box and comes with five blades instead of just one. I didn't expect much from the included blades, though, and also got someblades which cut at least as well and might last longer. They fit both knifes.
customer_reviews.author: Jonas Dohu

customer_reviews.title: Good for 8 months, until the plastic blade lock broke.
customer_reviews.text: I was quite happy with this until today, when after 8 months of periodic use and changes of blade, that little black plastic button on the side of the blade holder cracked and the blade went flying solo and hit me in the leg. No damage done to me, just my clothes, but the button is toast and with it, so's the utility knife. The fold lock button on the grip is metal. I really wish the blade lock button had been, as it's the weak point which did in an otherwise good tool. Wouldn't buy again while that plastic button remains a thing.
customer_reviews.author: Scylla

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: I decided I was sick and tired of the nasty, old carpet in my den. I started cutting it up with a cheap knife, but it quickly started hurting my hands. Desperate to continue working, but minus hand pain, I bought this knife. I'm so glad I did! It's comfortable to use for long periods. The locking mechanism held securely, no matter how hard I pressed. The blades rapidly dull when cutting carpet and pad, so the quick-change design was a fantastic time-saver. This knife is a welcome addition to my toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive
customer_reviews.text: Geez, this bad boy is sharp, looks really good, has a great locking mechanism...and it even comes with a nice little pouch you can keep it in. Five stars across the board from me. I bought this product in particular in order to cut up large tv boxes and other orders/shipments I received. This way I can dispose of them in the recycle bin easier or take them to the dump. This pocket utility knife cut through large boxes like it was butter. I'll have to come back up here and post pics but it's very impressive, simply put.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Ray

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: The knife is well-built and easy to use, however the pot-metal latch button that holds the blade from sliding out is weak and broke the first day of use cutting 1/2" siding foam (similar to when the part was being made from plastic). Cutting pink foam isn't exactly a difficult job for the knife, which is now useless as the blade pulls out pretty quickly. The button is still the weak link. As a note, the knife only locks fully open or closed, unlike other knives, so it isn't as convenient as other knives.
customer_reviews.author: Dyno Spoid

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad...
customer_reviews.text: The knife feels like it's sturdy and won't fail from use. Has a quick release button which is nice for switching out the blades. The bad comes from the fact that the button to close/open it is located where you'd typically hold it while cutting. On more than one occasion already, I've accidentally engaged closing it while cutting. So while the knife itself is nice, the location of that button makes it where I consciously have to think about not putting my finger on it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan B

customer_reviews.title: Functional Art
customer_reviews.text: I love love love the look of this knife, and I have never marveled at the appearance of a utility knife before ;) I was seeking for the ability to drop a utility knife into my jeans pocket without ripping up my leg, and this does it very well. Nice feel in my hand, and the blade stays locked. It also comes with some replacement blades and a soft belt case that doesn't fit the knife especially well (too short for the Velcro flap to grab securely unless it is really jammed in there). However, case aside, I think it is a great knife at a great price - and who needs to hide it in a case? Not me!
customer_reviews.author: D. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS KNIFE!
customer_reviews.text: This utility box-cutter-type knife is beautifully designed and works wonderfully. A touch of a button allows one to retract or open it. The touch of another button allows change of blade. Five replacement blades, well and compactly packaged, are provided free with the knife. It has a convenient metal attachment for quick hooking to one's belt. It comes with an attractive compact cloth carrying case which also has a belt loop. All in all, a wonder in this age of cheap materials and knock-offs. It has my highest recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A high quality item
customer_reviews.text: One of those things you didn’t know you needed. Where I come from you don’t gift a knife, otherwise I would’ve bought a bunch as gifts. Makes opening boxes so much easier! As well as safer. Folds for safe storage and is opened by pressing a button. Doesn’t spring open, you have to unfold, but it’s easy and smooth. The finish and how it opens very high quality, makes me want to look up more items from this manufacturer. Comes with a pack of replacement blades, but it takes a while to wear one (and then you can first flip it in the holder).
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wazowski

customer_reviews.title: Both knives had defective locking feature
customer_reviews.text: I contacted the company approximately 2 months ago about the first knife being unable to lock the blade in place. They assured me this was uncharistic for this knife and were going to send me a replacement. I have not gotten the replacement. Two weeks ago the same thing happened to the 2nd knife. I hope they see this review and I can get both knives replaced. I have the broken knives if they would like them returned to them.
customer_reviews.author: kathya

customer_reviews.title: Opens easy, and cuts great, and the blade folds out of way for storage
customer_reviews.text: I like this knife it's very strong, it cuts through heavy cardboard boxes very nicely. I'm handicapped so do a lot of mail order shopping makes it easier for me and my family. So I needed a strong knife to cut open boxes and to cut the tough plastic around items. Plus I cut up the boxes to fit into trash. I recommend this knife highly. I'm going to order another one soon for my husband he likes it also. This way I can hide mine from him so I will have it when I need it (that's a hint to wifes).
customer_reviews.author: Wepola

customer_reviews.title: Super useful
customer_reviews.text: Now that it’s the holidays, I’ve been getting so many boxes from Amazon. I realized that I couldn’t keep using my old kitchen knife and decided to purchase this pocket utility knife and it has been so helpful when opening packages! It comes with a case that closes by velcro and you are able to fit both the knife and the extra blades in the case. The knife cuts really smoothly, closes easily, and I quickly learned how to work it. I didn’t realize what I was missing before!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: ... knife specifically to cut up cardboard and is very pleased with the quality and craftsmanship that has gone into ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this utility knife specifically to cut up cardboard and is very pleased with the quality and craftsmanship that has gone into the making of this tool. He is very satisfied with his purchase and the service from the company. The only thing he has found, with his arthritic hands, the handle gets uncomfortable after cutting. Some sort of padding would be great.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Cox

customer_reviews.title: Solid knife, but a bit bulky.
customer_reviews.text: The frame is well built and the locking mechanism is solid. Blade locks in tight, but is easy to change. If they could slim it down just a little it would a be 5 star winner. Only fault is that it is bulky. Like this style knife to keep in my pocket while working for a few quick cuts or to open a box, etc... If I'm using a knife all day I'll go with a traditional utility knife.
customer_reviews.author: Jay L

customer_reviews.title: It looked really promising but now disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the color and the fact that we got extra razors. I had high hopes for it, but not even a week after getting the box cutter the little plastic bit that holds the razor in place broke off, I haven’t even dropped it. Its just really upsetting that this product couldn’t last a week. I would have given this easily 5 stars if they didn’t want to cut ends with the piece that holds the razor in place. I wouldn’t recommend it look somewhere else don’t waste your time and money on this. This is really disappointing for a product that had so much promise
customer_reviews.author: Jose Lira

customer_reviews.title: Awesome utility knife
customer_reviews.text: Awesome utility knife, if this one ever breaks I would buy another one. Fast delivery, exactly what is described. Very durable, fits your hand perfect, easy to change blades. Also blade can flip out like a switch blade with a flip of the wrist plus holding the release button. Love this knife, thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Mine gets a lot of use, Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I get all these boxes from Amazon, I am constantly cutting them down for the recycling bin. The knife works great, the blade stays secure and I don't get the sense its going to break off in my hand. This was a nice upgrade from my old classic Stanley razor knife. If you are looking for one, I think you'll probably be happy with this one. The included holster is nice to have.
customer_reviews.author: Horse-N-Round

customer_reviews.title: Solid high quality knife.
customer_reviews.text: Quality Quality Quality. I was tired of flimsy plastic retractable knives and was looking for something sturdy. A knife that you can use force with and not feeling it will break like happens with retractable knives. Solid grip inspires confidence for usage.
customer_reviews.author: Sol322

customer_reviews.title: aesthetically pleasing and very useful
customer_reviews.text: For what it's worth, what more could you ask for? It doesn't look cheap and really sturdy in the hands. The only thing I wish it offers is different color options, such as matte black would be nice, other than that, I'm a satisfied customer! Oh, it comes with a few extra blades just in case you need it. All of this for less than $15! I like what Fancii offers on Amazon, especially its design.
customer_reviews.author: MasterSushi

customer_reviews.title: Simple design yet very effective
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy how simple this box cutter is. No screwdriver needed to change the blade, it has a release button on the side of the knife for easy replacement. A knob to release the knife from the locked position and it even come with a plastic guard to protect yourself from injury (if it occurs) and and extra set of blades. Also that sheath that comes with the box cutter puts the Fancii in Fancii.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd.H.Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't replace the blade
customer_reviews.text: I used it exactly once to cut through 10mm EVA foam sheets. When the first blade dulled, I tried to push/hold the button to replace it. It wouldn't budge at all! I got so ticked after a 30 min battle, I applied too much pressure using a binder clip and a metal counter that something underneath the button broke. The blade comes out, but it won't hold a new blade in place. Going back to cheapo box cutters.
customer_reviews.author: Kariotic

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, cheap, pay a little more for something better.
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made. The exterior actually feels sturdy, but within MINUTES of using for the first time the mechanism that holds the blade in the knife broke and now the blade just slides in and out freely making the knife useless. You get wh aw t you pay for. Returning and paying a little more for a better product.
customer_reviews.author: kristin bachelder

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret buying this knife
customer_reviews.text: Love this knife!! I bought it to replace one I had for years and I thought was irreplaceable. I was wrong. It has a nice sturdy body and lock in the blade very securely. I also like that you have to press the button for it to open as well as close. Just in case little fingers get ahold of it by accident.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: buy this knife, you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is a great knife. I use this kind of knife to cut cardboard boxes into pieces small enough that they will fill a 13 gallon kitchen trash bag without tearing it. I do that to facilitate taking cardboard to the recycling bin. Sometimes I need to use my bicycle to transport the recycling, and 13 gallon bags are fairly easy to strap to my bicycle. The knife is easy to open and close, and it is very easy to turn a blade around, or to put in a new one. I would recommend this to anyone who just needs a sharp knife for basic use.
customer_reviews.author: Shreks

customer_reviews.title: Seemed sturdy, blade lock broke after using a few times
customer_reviews.text: It seemed to be well made, at first, but the locking mechanism broke after just a couple of months, over which period I used the knife maybe a dozen times under very light use, as intended, for breaking down boxes. The locking mechanism is a very small piece of soft plastic, which, compared to the rest of the knife, seems very under-designed and of poor material quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S.

customer_reviews.title: great little knife for a great little price
customer_reviews.text: Sharp as a razor (because it uses a sharp replaceable blade). Fits my hand well and I feel comfortable using it ( I have small hands and arthritic thumb joints and I feel fine using this knife). Love the little belt pouch for it and the little cap over the blde to keep it sharp and protected when folded. easy to use. Easy to replace teh blade.
customer_reviews.author: Too Little Space

customer_reviews.title: 5-Star Performer!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought this knife a year ago! I moved from CT to GA last May and had tons of boxes to break down, plus lots of Amazon boxes since I do a lot of my shopping here. This knife makes all that so much easier. It is much more comfortable than the big box store utility cutters because of the design of the handle. You do have to be careful closing it not to nip your fingers with the blade. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: CT Yankee gal

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and strong little knife!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been using this utility knife for a couple of months now and it’s been great. We’ve used it for all kinds of home improvement projects from box cutting, ripping up carpet, removing caulk, and installing vinyl plank flooring, among other things. The knife is so far still sharp and in great shape. Very versatile and strong!
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Easy to break, use caution
customer_reviews.text: Great knife handle for my work mechanic toolbox. Went to use it yesterday and the blade wouldn’t stay in. The grip latch mechanism had broke. While looking for warranty info (non existent past 30 days), I noticed others are having same exact failure. I can’t say Don’t buy this, because it did work well for a period.
customer_reviews.author: denver kirsch

customer_reviews.title: Superb Quality - Beats DeWalt Hands-Down!
customer_reviews.text: I had just purchased a DeWalt utility knife, expecting a high-quality piece of equipment - it was a piece of junk and I returned it. The moment you hold the FC Folding Knife you will know that it is very well made - sort of like closing the door of a well-built car and hearing that deep "Thunk". This knife will last a very, very long time.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, durable utility knife with a low profile
customer_reviews.text: This is my first utility knife so keep that in mind with the review, but I have been using it lightly on different packages and other items for about 3 months now. The knife has stayed sharp and no replacement blades have been needed. The knife is easy to use and the low profile makes it easy to carry it in a pocket or anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Blade Change Button Lasted 1 Year
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept of the knife and it was my favorite utility knife I have owned. Unfortunately, the button for changing the blade was weak and broke after about 1 year of use. I pressed it to change the blade and it just crack in half and stuck. Now it won't hold a blade. Failure at 1 year of homeowner type use is just not durable enough. I got 10 years out of my last knife. I really expected more based on the seeming quality of the rest of the knife.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Fish

customer_reviews.title: No doubt, this will be the last box cutter I’ll need to buy.
customer_reviews.text: Let me just say, whoever designed this cutter had to have been as frustrated as I have in dealing with box cutters that were difficult to manage, kept breaking or sticking etc. This is a piece of work so if you want a cutter that will last and do what it is supposed to do flawlessly, don’t hesitate to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Yanasak

customer_reviews.title: Very nice utility knife. Its my new goto work knife.
customer_reviews.text: The knife- Feels very well constructed. I like that it has a release button to open and close the knife. Easy to operate with one hand. Easy blade change button. The Storage pouch- The pocket is a big enough to fit the knife and the extra blades in it. At first look it looks and feels cheap but after using for a couple days it seems like it will hold up good. Overall very nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Best one out there.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best folding utility knife I've used and I've used most of the ones out there. Easy one handed opening. Blade stays put until you want to remove it. It doesn't come loose unexpectedly which seems to be a problem with most other folding utility knives. Fancii has made a sturdy, well engineered (not over engineered) tool that will last. I liked the first one so much I bought a second one to keep in the shop.
customer_reviews.author: 3eyedraven

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous. the blade doesn't lock and moves when being used
customer_reviews.text: Dangerous! This knife actually doesnt lock the blade! I had to toss it and replace.
customer_reviews.author: Magnolia

customer_reviews.title: I have used it for a year.........
customer_reviews.text: ......I used it every day, at my shop for about a year and it is wearing out. I can no longer get the blades to stay in place and it is starting to get a little dangerous to use. But, for the price, it worked very well and it would be a great buy for someone that needs one for occasional use for the home.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Crossont

customer_reviews.title: What a great product
customer_reviews.text: This tool has made my work very easy. I am installing rolled aluminum siding for the first time and I saw folks online using this tool with a curved bladed. I purchased the same curved blades and they fit perfect with this product. Awesome tool, awesome service and awesome price. Thank you so much. Good luck and all the best too you. :)
customer_reviews.author: G. Pabon

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Makes cutting up cardboard boxes very smooth and easy. Much better than the smaller plastic knife I had been using. I like that the blade locks open and closed very securely. It took a couple of times to get the blade inserted so that it wouldn't fall out, but once I figured out that you have to make sure you slide the blade as far as it will go back towards the handle, it locked securely and works fine. Nice solid feel. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Strob

customer_reviews.title: Solid built, lock open, lock closed blade.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid built: one easy push button to open and close blade. The blade locks open and locks closed. Changing blades is also easy with a push button for releasing the blade. Comes with extra 5 blades and a carrying pouch that has room for the knife, extra blades and belt loop attachable. The bare knife also has a clip attachment for solo pocket carry.
customer_reviews.author: vet

customer_reviews.title: Great UT knife ... but be advised...
customer_reviews.text: Solid, handy, well-engineered utility knife with safe, easy blade swap. HOWEVER --- you might want to check local laws if you plan on toting this to and from work. With the lock stud depressed this knife WILL easil "flick" open. Word to the wise, especially in NY --- the clip + the "flick" can probably get you into arraignment. Other than that (or including that, depending on your work requirements) it is a fantastic knife.
customer_reviews.author: MeteorMagnet

customer_reviews.title: Quality utility knife
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of the old Stanley classic, decided to replace more than just the blade. Got this Fancii utility knife and maybe its just the sharp new blades but this thing cuts through cardboard with ease. I like the flip knife style over the retracting blade. The pocket clip kind of gets in the way sometimes, but is useful.
customer_reviews.author: Tan Gent

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but some QC needed
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good but not perfect. Seems to function OK but I noticed a bur on the thumb rest. I took the thumb rest off and popped the bur off and we're good. I do like the quick change feature. I wanted a utility knife without the pesky thumb release button. This folds up and comes with a little pouch and some spare blades.
customer_reviews.author: WireKAT

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Bought this knife on March 9th. Lasted about a month while using it to cut up cardboard boxes. It worked great for that. Today I used it to cut out a small piece of drywall, and the black metal blade lock *cracked* and broke. Think about that. The metal lock holding the blade was brittle enough to crack under pressure. The blade will no longer stay in the knife, rendering it useless. Extremely disappointing end to what started out to be a strong product. Going to replace it with something USA made instead.
customer_reviews.author: slush

customer_reviews.title: Good at first but...  dangerous when they break
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews but in this case I fell I need to. --We have purchased a number of these before we realized the lack of quality. The knife starts off great and works for a few weeks or a few months and then the pin that holds the blade in place will break loose. This is not only frustrating but also dangerous as the blade can come back on you and could cut you. --I do no recommend this unit even though the price is great, it needs to last in order to be a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: K Haaland

customer_reviews.title: Great utility tool
customer_reviews.text: This utility knife is fantastic! It's lightweight and durable and perfect for crafts and other household project. I love knives and cutting things up. So I tested it out on several different things. It's great for cardboard, eva foam, thin wood, fabric, carpet, sheetrock, leather, pleather, plastic and rubber. Since it folds up, it's a lot safer than traditional box cutters. I would still suggest keeping it out of the reach of children.
customer_reviews.author: Leah B.

customer_reviews.title: Two knives, one lost because of design, one defective.
customer_reviews.text: Pocket hook likes to snag on anything and everything as it is flared too far out. Lost one knife because of this. Second knife purchased was defective, and the blade lock would not operate properly. Needs some work to flip open like the Milwaukee fastback, but does eventually get there. Knife is excessively bulky and doesnt really fold all the way, just enough to hide the edge. Feels solid, blades are very sharp, even for a razor, but overpriced for my experience with them ($14 each). Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This a box cutter which usable replaceable standard razor blades. It folds so the blade is safely in the handle when not in use. It also comes with a blade guard for extra accident prevention. The itself is sturdy, with the locking mechanism holding everything in place well. The part that holds the blade itself into place could be a little sturdier though, but it doesn't look like it's going to break anytime soon. The set also includes several replacement blades and a belt pouch.
customer_reviews.author: joeuth

customer_reviews.title: I love this knife
customer_reviews.text: I love this knife. Ability to put in standard new utility blades with quick release is great. Always sharp. A couple of suggestions for the next design: Lose the pocket clip or make it removable. It makes the knife bulkier if you carry it in your pocket. Also, the location of the button is a little dangerous. When I cut boxes open and accidentally press the button while I am using it, the knife partially unlocks and folds about half way. I would prefer the button be on the heel of the knife. Other than these small issues, it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a handsome utility folder. While the push button release precludes deployment by one hand, it is very sure and steady. Might be a bit large for EDC unless your trade requires it. Certainly no larger than other popular models! Blade is held securely, pocket clip is very welcome. The holster is nothing to write home about, but serviceable and free blades are a welcome goody. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Mac

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool helps with flooded homes...
customer_reviews.text: I live near Hurricane Harvey flooded areas in Houston and saw this product listed in a blog post listing instructions on after flood cleanup. They recommended this item for removing carpeting and sheetrock. I bought 2 to give to neighbors who are out helping in the cleanup efforts. They greatly appreciated this heavy duty knife with extra blades included. Very reasonable price too!
customer_reviews.author: aajava

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Slices through boxes with great stability and can cut up a great number of boxes before dulling. Easy to switch blades in and out and the cloxe/open lock feature makes it easy to use. Push the button and flick your wrist and the blade is deployed and ready to work. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Easy opening utility knife
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fine: I like the side lock works fine, the knife easily opens one-handed. I might have to see if I can adjust the tension so it doesn't open quite so fast and bounce back halfway closed. The plastic blade lock could be better, in fact, would prefer not plastic. When trying to replace the blade, I found it was difficult to get seated squarely. Result being you have to fiddle with a sharp blade that wants to rotate slightly backwards--this one aspect I really think needs fixing.
customer_reviews.author: Jed Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Love my knife
customer_reviews.text: Love my knife, it's sharp, and easy to find if I put it down. My co-worker also liked my knife when I showed it to him so I also ordered one for him. I ordered this knife again because I'd inadvertently set my knife down and someone took it. Someone else at my workplace has an excellent utility knife. This knife is extremely solid, unlike the light weight ones that they give us at work and since the ones from work are small, they're also easy to lose.
customer_reviews.author: Debra E. Lux

customer_reviews.title: Rubber blade holder broke after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 4 months and used it 8-12 times. Last night, while cutting a cardboard box, the black rubber piece that holds the blade in slipped and the blade came out and stuck in the box. Now, the blade won't completely stay locked in. Kinda worrisome that it could happen with razor blades. Can't seem to find warranty info or a customer service contact....
customer_reviews.author: Edward T Smallman

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: This makes opening boxes feel so nice. It cuts very smoothly with a super sharp blade. Cardboard or paper is cut with ease using this bad boy. Folds in half to make it safe when you put it away, great safety feature for kids. Also great high quality exterior with good grip
customer_reviews.author: Poizoni

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like this product. I'm a female and the grip fits perfectly in my hand. Comfortable to hold and not heavy or awkward. Changing the blade can be a bit difficult because the release button tends to stick but it's nothing terrible. Overall I'd buy the product again and definitely recommend it for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Tay

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done and looks cool doing it
customer_reviews.text: No need to be needlessly verbose about something as simple as a utility knife. Simply put, you won't find higher quality for this price...or even for a a higher price. It's great looking knife. Works perfectly and folds up easily. Safety lock is strong. Even comes with a cool case and extra blades. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Erick Bieger

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Design
customer_reviews.text: Who ever designed this was fully cognizant of the of the basic safety features lacking in the standard box/carpet cutters that have been available in the past. This is a well thought out design from a safety, ergonomic and functional aspect. It is worth every penny spent in my opinion and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray J.

customer_reviews.title: Broke day 2
customer_reviews.text: It broke when I applied medium-light pressure to cut through cardboard. Now, the blade wont stay in place. The kobalt one I replaced had lasted me years of the same use.
customer_reviews.author: Bog

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and Precise!
customer_reviews.text: Works really good; it is beyond sharp, but controllable and tucks away nicely in it's sheath so no worries about accidentally cutting yourself. Cut through some heavy cardboard boxes I had like a knife going through butter!
customer_reviews.author: Woden1ragnar2

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Hold Up After 4 Months of Weekly Use
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed by the design of this knife. I primarily used it to cut cardboard boxes for recycling so I only used it once a week. After 4 months the tab that holds the blade secure in the knife seemed to have broken as the blade no longer stays secure in the knife and potentially becomes dangerous to use because of it. This seems like a design flaw in this product so I will not be purchasing another one and will look to something sturdier for my recycling needs.
customer_reviews.author: the.kev

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction
customer_reviews.text: Im very happy with this blade. It opens quickly with a button push and wrist flip. The blade is held firmly, changes easily, and doesn't have any wiggle. I had a realization the other day at work after once again sharpening my $90 Spyderco pocket knife that 95% of the time I'm using it to cut cardboard and the like.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp
customer_reviews.text: The blade is deceptively sharp but also very useful for opening boxes. I like that you have to press and hold the safety button to open the knife so it won't open on accident. There are five replacement blades but I haven't had to change out the blade yet. Knife feels and looks well made.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and very durable
customer_reviews.text: Locks perfectly cuts through paper cardboard very easily and also comes with extra blades as well good color for you to know where it is and also feels very durable i through it around a couple times and it still works all the locking features and everything else
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: The perfect utility knife !!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product for the warehouse aspect of running our small business, more convenient than a traditional utility / box cutter style knife. Easy to carry in your pocket, simple blade change process makes it the perfect tool for stocking shelves and breaking down cardboard boxes for recycling. Great price, excellent provider for the product!!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M

customer_reviews.title: GREAT until the plastic thing breaks
customer_reviews.text: Like many others have said, this is a fantastic utility knife, but the little plastic blade lock fails eventually. It's because if you are making a drawing motion, a great deal of that force is also being brought to bear on the blade holder. If they made this out of metal like the rest of it, then it might hold up. I'm contemplating drilling and tapping a tiny thumb screw into the broken one to solidly hold the blade.
customer_reviews.author: PJ New York

customer_reviews.title: Other than that it's cool.
customer_reviews.text: There is no pace to hold extra blades. Other than that it's cool.
customer_reviews.author: yeppers

customer_reviews.title: They broke after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Had these for about 2 or 3 months then they broke, they won't keep/hold the blade anymore. Cheap unreliable product. Went to Lowe's and got a Kobalt knife for not much more than this
customer_reviews.author: LXK

customer_reviews.title: Blade locking mechanism broke after 6 months!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this utility knife till I took it out of my pocket one day and the blade locking part of it was broke! I only have had it for 6 months! Now it's totally useless.
customer_reviews.author: Moondog

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I used my cutter for the first time yesterday, had a lot of heavy boxes to cut down for pickup. I had been using a smaller box cutter that required multiple cuts with a lot of pressure to cut through. This cutter slid through the thickest boxes like a hot knife through butter! A clean cut first time with no effort. The cutter appears to be very well made. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: myra

customer_reviews.title: Cheap materials.
customer_reviews.text: Came broken. Amazon won’t refund or replace without me spending more money, to ship their broken product back, even with image proof of the damage from the cheaply made product.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylee

customer_reviews.title: Broke in a month; used sold as new
customer_reviews.text: The blade lock mechanism broke after one month. When investigating problem, I looked closely at the screw and it appeared that someone else had already damaged the head. So I assume it was returned by prior purchaser and then sold to me as new.
customer_reviews.author: BL in Balto

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, unfortunately. Bad company.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two, after one month one of them is faulty and will not hold the blade,anymore. Very disappointed. Was a gift! Also, I must add, I cannot return..or, replace. I month and any refund is up! Terrible customer service! I should be receiving a replacement at least!
customer_reviews.author: Augustvonimatru

customer_reviews.title: the single plastic part will break
customer_reviews.text: The plastic button which holds the blade in just broke on my knife after light use, as it has on so many others. Go elsewhere - complete waste of money. Missing from the plastic piece shown in the photo is an even smaller nub that should hold the blade in - without something to hold it, useless.
customer_reviews.author: C.G.

customer_reviews.title: Great utility knife !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with this box cutter/utility knife. It is far superior to ones I have had in the past. Very easy to open & close and change blades. Comes with a nice case too. Besides all that it is pretty. Thanks for making a great product that aids in opening all those boxes I get from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after minimal use
customer_reviews.text: The knife is comfortable and the flip locking mechanism is stable. However, the retention lock no longer works on mine and the blade falls out. I bought the knife in December and have used it occaisionally to cut foam core boards. I am still using the original blade. *I sent a message to the seller and will update my review based on the response.*
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Zero customer support
customer_reviews.text: Good luck getting any sort of customer support for your purchase after the pivot nut falls out and you're left with two halves of a useless tool.
customer_reviews.author: Scott P. Moran

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty but not what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I wanted the blade part to fold back entirely in the metal case. It did not. While no part of the sharp blade was showing I still felt it wasn't entirely safe. The manufacturer should have shown a picture of the blade closed as well as open.
customer_reviews.author: isobel

customer_reviews.title: Solid body, weak blade holder.
customer_reviews.text: This product lasted for about 4 and a half months under moderate to high use. I would not recommend the product due to the weak construction of the blade holder. In my 4 year old cheap box cutter you can see 2 blade holders - even though they are plastic they apparently hold up better than the single metal holder. I loved the extremely solid body and the folding mechanism, but this will not last despite those features.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Olson

customer_reviews.title: Great knife!
customer_reviews.text: I just tossed my 1970's Stanley knife away after I received my Fanci pocket knife. I love the ease of opening and closing the knife. Also the ease in replacing the blade. The old utility knife had to be stored under the bed now I not only have it handy in my desk drawer, I can take it with me when I travel.
customer_reviews.author: beverly

customer_reviews.title: Best Box Cutter
customer_reviews.text: I receive product monthly in a very large box, and I have a very hard time breaking it down to put in recycle bin. I purchased this box cutter hoping it would make my chore easier. It cuts through the cardboard with ease and is the best purchase I have made in long time. I highly recommend it!!!
customer_reviews.author: LJF

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: The perfect utility knife! I got this because I wanted a knife I could use to cut cardboard, Or open random packages. THis is perfect and I love how they use common razor blades making it cheap and easy to replace when needed. It feels strong and durable and doesn't seem like it will ever need to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: GreenCowLand

customer_reviews.title: Great Razor - Perfect for my Needs
customer_reviews.text: Sharp and comes with 5 extra blades where either side can be used for cutting so essentially 12 blades are included. Perfect for opening boxes at work and way sharper than the company supplied ones. The hilt is very solid and the locking mechanism does not budge. Very quality razor for under $15
customer_reviews.author: Candace W Levine

customer_reviews.title: Sweet, solid knife!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this knife for a while now and while I haven't used it a ton, whenever I do pick it up I'm always reminded just what a quality little blade it is. It looks great, feels great, and works great! (And it cost next to nothing!:-)
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. M.

customer_reviews.title: Best utility knife I've ever used!
customer_reviews.text: Use this knife once, and you'll never want to use another utility knife again. In my view, the folding feature is not about making it compact (folding it doesn't really make it much smaller for carry). It's about covering the blade without using the awful retraction methods used by most utility knives. This knife is rock-solid when open, provides a good grip, and operates very smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Owen

customer_reviews.title: Finally - a good box cutter!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product to have around to open and break down boxes. Be careful - it is very sharp! It is sturdy enough to cut through heavy boxes and those straps that come with some larger products. We keep it handy and use it all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Catgetsdown

customer_reviews.title: An excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: It’s a well-balanced box cutter of solid, all-metal construction. The razor blades are very easily changed. Both locking mechanisms are secure. Far better for cutting carpeting than purpose-made carpet knives; those have been useless for me.
customer_reviews.author: Romaine Coughlin

customer_reviews.title: Must buy!
customer_reviews.text: Really good box cutter for the price. I came with a set of razor blades which I thought was a nice touch. Speaking of which, I had to shave off a bit of the end piece as the angles on it pressed into my large hands. Other than that the ergonomics are great!
customer_reviews.author: Gabyzg

customer_reviews.title: Does What it Says on the Tin
customer_reviews.text: It's a fancy box cutter (the belt clip even says "Fancii"). The red matches my car so I guess that's neat. When it's locked into position, it stays locked. It worked well during a day of cutting boxes for the recycling bin. Replacing blades looks simple enough. That's pretty much all I can say about this product. It does what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: the_cursor

customer_reviews.title: Great utility knife
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to replace another one, of a different brand, that was similar that started falling apart. This folding utility knife is easy to lock and unlock as well as change the blades. I liked it so much I bought a second one to always have one handy.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Radicsh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent razor knife. The kid at work lost my old Stanley one, so I decided to try one of these flip types. SO glad I did. This model feels very solid and balanced, blade changes are a breeze, and it even came with a case to put on your belt. Nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for crafting and workshop!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this knife for craft projects from weeding vinyl letters to cutting fabric (and just about anything). It's become my new companion in my craft room. I need a second one for my workshop as it always seems to happen that when I'm in the basement workshop the knife is in the second floor craft room, and vice versa. You know how that goes! ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Westcott

product_meta.title: FC Folding Pocket Utility Knife - Heavy Duty Box Cutter with Holster, Quick Change Blades, Lock-Back Design, and Lightweight Aluminum Body
product_meta.description:
THE EVERYDAY POCKET KNIFE 
Equipped with heavy-duty carbon steel blades, this utility knife is great for a variety of tasks, such as opening boxes, slicing rope, cutting wallpapers, carpets, cardboards and plastics. 

EASY AND SAFE 
Simple one button lock-back design locks the blade in place for safe and efficient cutting, The blade is secured even when not in use.

QUICK BLADE CHANGE 
Easy access button for quick blade change with no additional tools required. Accepts all standard size utility knife blades. 

COMPACT AND FOLDABLE 
Folds easily and fits in your pocket for quick retrieval. When open, the knife measures 6.6 inches, and it closes down to 4.3 inches. It's weighs at just 4.8 ounces. 

MADE TO LAST 
This pocket-sized cutter is made with high quality anodized aluminum and stainless steel, which is durable, lightweight, and rust-resistant. The ergonomic non-slip handle offers a secure grip and is comfortable to hold for a prolong period of time.

TAKE IT ANYWHERE 
The stainless steel clip allows you to carry it with you wherever you go. It can be used as a belt or money clip. This knife is great for use at home, on the job or outdoors. 

✔ Backed by a 100% RISK FREE Money Back Guarantee! 
If you are not satisfied with our knife, we will give you a full refund.
feature_bullets: Sleek, lightweight anodized aluminum design with anti-slip grip. Handle doubles as pocket or money clip
Heavy-duty carbon steel blades stay sharp longer. Convenient folding with the press of a button.
Lock-back design safely locks the blade in place when in use
Quick-change mechanism for easy blade removal | Accepts standard size utility blades.
Includes a knife holster and 5 extra replacement blades

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,150 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
